commandsParsing

Class CommandHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • commandsParsing.CommandHandler

  • public class CommandHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles each command specified in RFC 821
    Author:
    Martin Holecek

      • CommandHandler

        public CommandHandler(Session session,
                      java.lang.String mailbox,
                      DBConnect database)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        session - sends and receives messages from the SMTP Server
        mailbox - is domain name of the server
        database - connects to the database

    • Method Detail

      • getCommand

        public java.lang.String getCommand()
        Get Command parsed from the message client sends
        Returns:
        command is four character string

      • getArgument

        public java.lang.String getArgument()
        Get argument parsed from the message client sends
        Returns:
        argument (parameters) of the command

      • parseCommand

        public boolean parseCommand(java.lang.String message)
        Parses command by spaces
        Parameters:
        message - is a string sended by the client which is parsed by spaces.
        Returns:
        true if there is command and argument or return false if there is not argument or if there is more then one argument

      • parseHELO

        public boolean parseHELO()
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Handles HELO Command
        Returns:
        always return true, false is not implemented
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if data stream are not available

      • parseMAIL

        public boolean parseMAIL()
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Handles MAIL Command
        Returns:
        false only when there is error with reading from database, otherwise there is true
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if data stream are not available

      • parseDATA

        public boolean parseDATA()
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Handles DATA Command
        Returns:
        false only when there is error with reading from database or if SQL Query fails, otherwise there is true
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if data stream are not available

      • clearBuffers

        private void clearBuffers()
        Clear the buffers. This method will clear forward string and reverse arraylist. Also sets the mail command and recipients command to false.

      • parseRSET

        public boolean parseRSET()
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Handles Reset Command. This command specifies that the current mail transaction is to be aborted. Any stored sender, recipients, and mail data must be discarded, and all buffers and state tables cleared. The receiver must send an OK reply.
        Returns:
        false only when there is error with reading from database or if SQL Query fails, otherwise there is true
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if data stream are not available

      • parseNOOP

        public boolean parseNOOP()
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Handles NOOP Command. This command does not affect any parameters or previously entered commands. It specifies no action other than that the receiver send an OK reply.
        Returns:
        false only when there is error with reading from database or if SQL Query fails, otherwise there is true
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if data stream are not available

      • parseQUIT

        public boolean parseQUIT()
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Handles QUIT Command. This command specifies that the receiver must send an OK reply, and then close the transmission channel.
        Returns:
        false and close the transmission channel, this commands does not use arguments but if client will send any arguments the method will return true
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if data stream are not available

      • parseSEND

        public boolean parseSEND()
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Handles SEND Command. This command is not implemented which sends 502 response back to the client.
        Returns:
        false only when there is error with reading from database or if SQL Query fails, otherwise there is true
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if data stream are not available

      • parseSOML

        public boolean parseSOML()
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Handles SOML Command. This command is not implemented which sends 502 response back to the client.
        Returns:
        false only when there is error with reading from database or if SQL Query fails, otherwise there is true
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if data stream are not available

      • parseSAML

        public boolean parseSAML()
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Handles SAML Command. This command is not implemented which sends 502 response back to the client.
        Returns:
        false only when there is error with reading from database or if SQL Query fails, otherwise there is true
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if data stream are not available

      • parseTURN

        public boolean parseTURN()
                  throws java.io.IOException

        Returns:
